Posts.Content: My second go round was a flop, excuse the pun. Doc said I can increase dose in small amounts. Girlfriend was ready for some old fashioned sex , didn't happen. Going to increase dose this week, see what happens. The saga continues...
Posts.Title: TriMix Trial Run

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by trinity3 Good to hear. Did you discuss with doctor using the gel? The therapist wasn't too keen on the gel. Felt the injections work better and are cheaper. And insurance paid for a vial that has about 3 doses in it for $10.00.
Posts.Title: TriMix Trial Run

Posts.Content: Had a TriMix injection to get me "jump started". Worked like a charm. Doc used lowest dose and with the result I had, said I am right around the corner for recovery. Having a needle stuck in the base of your penis by a nice British lady was a bit bizarre, but fortunately painless. Now if I can just quit wearing Pads in my shorts, all would be great!

Posts.Content: Got my first Ultra Sensitive PSA test. Came back 0.015. Good news.
Posts.Title: A Little News Today!

Posts.Content: Am currently involved in the talc lawsuit due to my late wife's death from ovarian cancer. Asked about men's PC and talc and as far as anyone knows, there is no connection. Maybe down the road one day that will be different. research continues...
Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer and Talcum Powder Connection? And one other subject.

Posts.Content: Am currently involved in the talc lawsuit due to my late wife's death from ovarian cancer. Asked about men's PC and talc and as far as anyone knows, there is no connection. Maybe down the road one day that will be different. research continues...
Posts.Title: Prostate Cancer and Talcum Powder Connection? And one other subject.

Posts.Content: Down to one Tena pad per day 5 months post-op. Still had a couple of wet nights, due to being very tired upon going to bed and not getting woken up in the middle of the night with the urge to urinate. It's a slow progression getting back to "normal", whatever that turns out to be. ED still a issue, going to Doc next Tuesday to see if a new plan is in order. The saga continues...
Posts.Title: First day without urin pad

Posts.Title: First day without urin pad

Posts.Content: Now 7 months post-op and almost completely dry. Still a squirt when I sneeze hard or strain hard. Rarely use a pad unless going social and maybe having a few cocktails. Alcohol relaxes me and then I need more trips to the bathroom. As for sex it's been only possible with TriMix. I do sometimes get "semis" but they don't last, however it's a start. Have orgasms and it's different. Hard to explain but I guess it's what it's going to be from now on. Any thoughts on this? All in all I much happier, no more waking up soaked, which is the most frustrating part of RP, in my opinion. And, should I continue with Kegels, as I have lately been lax in doing them?
Posts.Title: UPDATE ON MY PC and QUESTIONS

Posts.Content: It is what it is.... I agree. Thanks for the feedback.
Posts.Title: UPDATE ON MY PC and QUESTIONS

Posts.Content: Am 7 weeks post op and am doing better. I spurt every time I move quickly or strain in any way. Also when sneezing or at work, as I am always up and down at work. So is the spurting versus the constant dribble I had a sign of my Kegels working? I do them twice a day and also at night the flow is greatly reduced. Just wondering if anyone has this experience also and is it a good sign?
Posts.Title: Incontinence Update

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Ron_G Sounds good for you. And now I have an Iron Maiden song in my head....thanks! Funny. Forgot about that tune.
Posts.Title: Post-Op Days

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Ron_G Sounds good for you. And now I have an Iron Maiden song in my head....thanks! Funny. Forgot about that tune.
Posts.Title: Post-Op Days

Posts.Content: Had my Da Vinci Tuesday and came home Thursday evening. Pain has gone down some and becoming more mobile and feeling better daily. Catheter is the Albatross as described in the poem" Rime Of The Ancient Mariner". Can't wait till next Tuesday for removal. Doc said surgery was textbook, seems all cancer in prostate was contained,( Biopsy pending). No lymph node removal, and nerves were moved with little trouble. Said I should recover with best possible results. (Fingers Crossed). I'll keep you guys posted. Thanks for all the support.
Posts.Title: Post-Op Days

Posts.Title: Post-Op Days

Posts.Content: Got mine out 7 days after surgery. Yes it is a PITA. But the transition to Depends is also a challenge. Learning what works with what clothing, how often to change, is a current learning curve for me. But it's better than that tube up your Johnson.

Posts.Title: Catheter after DaVinci

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by jfredfc As most have read, I had DaVinci on 1/20//16. Had some issues with UTI'S, including one a week ago, but that has cleared up and I am down to one pad a day. The frustrated part is that at time, I feel like a sexual cripple. I have tried Cialis and Viagra and they dont help but part of the problem there is that anytime, I try to self-stimulate or my wife tries to, I had leak badly. All I hear from the DR is that it just takes time. It got so bad yesterday when we tried, after completely voiding, I leaked real bad, she said she wanted to stop and I got up and left the house for while so I could go scream and cry for a few minutes. At times I just want to beat my head against the wall. Any thoughts guys? Understand what you're going through. I'm 7 months post op and just about completely dry. A few drops when I strain or exercise but that's it and that may be the way it will stay from now on. As for the ED, I'm still about 50%. I now am on a regimen of Cialis and have TriMix injection med when I need it. Being patient and not getting frustrated is hard to do but it does get better. Yes it takes time and you will get tired of hearing that, but it's the truth. Exercising and losing those extra pounds will help also. And lay off the booze if applicable. Hang in there.
Posts.Title: Seriously Frustrated

Posts.Content: Hey SeaCock. I'm in Katy too. Glad to see you are doing better, I had my surgery on the 12th. My Doc was Brian Miles in Methodist, who is Head of Urology there. When I get this catheter out maybe we can meet and have lunch and compare notes.
Posts.Title: New Memeber- Had My Da Vinci Surgery 12/11/20105

Posts.Content: I'd say it's the alcohol in the Nyquil. When I've had a few drinks(Crown Royal), I've had a few accidents like you did. So I have no cocktails or any fluids within 2-3 hours of going to bed. I recently had my left thumb operated on for Basal Joint Arthritis and was given Vicoden for the pain. Had the same experience as you did with the Nyquil. So my theory is that these products relax you to the point that you don't awaken in time when your bladder is full and you leak due to the pressure of a full bladder. So if you drink or are on meds before bed, put a pad in your undies.
Posts.Title: Thought I was On the Titanic!

Posts.Content: Thanks all. Have seen nothing since.
Posts.Title: Got a new question

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by MichiganMan16 Hey Bad: Nothing to worry about. It's quite normal. You may see some blood, as long as it's not super heavy, for a while. What you are describing sounds like nothing at all, no reason for concern. Good Luck. MM Thank you.
Posts.Title: Got a new question

Posts.Content: Got my catheter out Tuesday the 19th after surgery on the 12th( Da Vinci). Noticed last night a minute discoloration in my Depends which appeared to be pink in color, which indicates to me it's blood. Now I'm talking about a tiny slight discoloration, but still has me concerned if maybe I strained something inside or maybe a side effect of the cath removal. Any ideas fellows?

Posts.Title: Got a new question

Posts.Content: My Doc put me on one 5mg Cialis at bedtime Monday-Saturday then a 20 mg on Sunday night bedtime. This starting yesterday which is 2 weeks past my surgery. This therapy is to get the blood "flowing" at night during rest. Plus doing Kegels daily. In the meantime no exercise or straining for at least another 2 weeks. So you might want to leave that poor abused member alone and talk to your Doc.
Posts.Title: R-rated questions about 'rehab'

Posts.Title: Generic Cialis?

Posts.Content: Finally got my insurance issue resolved. Getting my 30 day for $24.00 versus $269.00 without insurance. Took a letter from my Atty. and an act of God to make the idiots at my script co. understand what the issue was. Will see my Urologist in a week for first follow-up since surgery. have lots of questions for him.
